2049.text: Restored from DNA found in amber, this Pokémon exhibited ferocity that was greater than expected. Some casualties resulted.

2050.text: It flew through the open skies over the ancient continent as if they were its own. When it touched ground, its walk was weak and slow.

2051.text: A savage Pokémon that died out in ancient times. It was resurrected using DNA taken from amber.

2052.text: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

2053.text: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

2054.text: SNORLAX’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile POKéMON that there are children who use its big belly as a place to play.

2055.text: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

2056.text: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn’t feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.

2057.text: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.

2058.text: Its stomach’s digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.

2059.text: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

2060.text: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.

2061.text: Snorlax’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.

2062.text: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk’s poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax’s tongue.

2063.text: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it’s asleep.

2064.text: It doesn’t do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.

2065.text: It has no interest in anything other than eating. Even if you climb up on its stomach while it’s napping, it doesn’t seem to mind at all!

2066.text: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.

2067.text: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

2068.text: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

2069.text: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.

2070.text: One of the legen­ dary bird POKéMON, it chills moisture in the atmosphere to create snow while flying.

2071.text: Legendary bird POKéMON. As it flies through the sky, it cools the air, causing snow to fall.

2072.text: ARTICUNO is a legendary bird POKéMON that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this POKéMON flies, snow will fall.

2073.text: One of the legendary bird POKéMON. With its long tail trailing behind, its flying form is magnificent.

2074.text: The magnificent, seemingly translucent wings of this legendary bird Pokémon are said to be made of ice.

2075.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon, it chills moisture in the atmosphere to create snow while flying.

2076.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

2077.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

2078.text: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

2079.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.

2080.text: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

2081.text: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

2082.text: Legendary bird POKéMON. They say lightning caused by the flapping of its wings causes summer storms.

2083.text: ZAPDOS is a legendary bird POKéMON that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. It gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

2084.text: One of the legendary bird POKéMON. While it is flying, it makes crackling and snapping sounds.

2085.text: This legendary bird Pokémon causes savage thunderstorms by flapping its glittering wings.

2086.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear only when a thundercloud parts into two halves.

2087.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

2088.text: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

2089.text: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

2090.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.

2091.text: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

2092.text: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.

2093.text: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

2094.text: Legendary bird POKéMON. It is said to migrate from the south along with the spring.

2095.text: One of the legendary bird POKéMON. Those seeing it are overwhelmed by its orange wings that seem to be on fire.

2096.text: This legendary Pokémon scatters embers with every flap of its wings. It is a thrilling sight to behold.

2097.text: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to bring early spring to the wintry lands it visits.

2098.text: It is said to be the legendary bird Pokémon of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flare of flames.

2099.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

2100.text: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

2101.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.

2102.text: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

2103.text: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

2104.text: It sheds many lay­ ers of skin as it grows larger. Dur­ ing this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

2105.text: Even the young can exceed 6.5 feet in length. It grows larger by repeatedly shedding skin.

2106.text: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

2107.text: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.

2108.text: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

2109.text: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.

2110.text: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.

2111.text: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.

2112.text: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

2113.text: It’s still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

2114.text: It sheds its skin—almost on a daily basis—and grows larger. Its skin is soft just after it’s been shed.

2115.text: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon’s existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.

2116.text: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.

2117.text: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

2118.text: It is called the divine POKéMON. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.

2119.text: A DRAGONAIR stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter the weather around it by loosing energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.

2120.text: It is said to live in seas and lakes. Even though it has no wings, it has been seen flying occasionally.

2121.text: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

2122.text: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

2123.text: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.

2124.text: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. It is said to have the ability to change the weather.

2125.text: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.

2126.text: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.

2127.text: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.

2128.text: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

2129.text: Some say that if you see it at the start of the year, flying through the sky and twisting its body, you’ll be healthy all year long.

2130.text: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.

2131.text: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.

2132.text: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

2133.text: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

2134.text: This marine POKé­ MON has an impres­ sive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.

2135.text: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.

2136.text: DRAGONITE is capable of circling the globe in just sixteen hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

2137.text: It can circle the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

2138.text: Only a very few people ever see this POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

2139.text: It is said that this Pokémon constantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drowning people.

2140.text: This marine Pokémon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.

2141.text: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.

2142.text: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

2143.text: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

2144.text: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.

2145.text: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.

2146.text: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship’s captain dubbed this Pokémon “the sea incarnate.”

2147.text: You’ll often hear tales of this kindhearted Pokémon rescuing people or Pokémon that are drowning.

2148.text: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.

2149.text: It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.

2150.text: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.

2151.text: Its DNA is almost the same as MEW's. However, its size and disposition are vastly dif­ ferent.

2152.text: Said to rest qui­ etly in an undiscovered cave, this POKéMON was created solely for battling.

2153.text: MEWTWO is a POKéMON that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this POKéMON’s body, they failed to endow MEWTWO with a compassionate heart.

2154.text: A POKéMON that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans made its body, they failed to give it a warm heart.

2155.text: A POKéMON whose genetic code was repeatedly recombined for research. It turned vicious as a result.

2156.text: Because its battle abilities were raised to the ultimate level, it thinks only of defeating its foes.

2157.text: It usually remains motionless to conserve energy, so that it may unleash its full power in battle.

2158.text: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

2159.text: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew’s genes. It’s said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

2160.text: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

2161.text: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

2162.text: When viewed through a micro­ scope, this POKéMON's short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

2163.text: Because it can learn any move, some people began research to see if it is the ancestor of all POKéMON.

2164.text: A MEW is said to possess the genes of all POKéMON. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

2165.text: A POKéMON of South America that was thought to have been extinct. It is very intelligent and learns any move.

2166.text: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

2167.text: Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.

2168.text: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

2169.text: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.

2170.text: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

2171.text: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

2172.text: Its pleasantly aromatic leaves have the ability to check the hu­ midity and tem­ perature.

2173.text: It loves to bask in the sunlight. It uses the leaf on its head to seek out warm places.

2174.text: It waves its leaf around to keep foes at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, creating a friendly atmosphere that becalms the battlers.

2175.text: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check humidity and temperature.

2176.text: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sun rays.

2177.text: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

2178.text: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

2179.text: The scent that wafts from the leaves on its neck causes anyone who smells it to become energetic.

2180.text: A BAYLEEF’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each leaf is a small tree shoot. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

2181.text: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.

2182.text: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

2183.text: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

2184.text: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

2185.text: Anyone who stands beside it becomes refreshed, just as if they were relaxing in a sunny forest.

2186.text: The fragrance of a MEGANIUM’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, it gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

2187.text: MEGANIUM’s breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

2188.text: Its breath has the fantastic ability to revive dead plants and flowers.

2189.text: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.

2190.text: Meganium’s breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

2191.text: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

2192.text: The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.

2193.text: CYNDAQUIL protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the POKéMON is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

2194.text: It flares flames from its back to protect itself. The fire burns vigorously if the POKéMON is angry. When it is tired, it sputters with incomplete combustion.

2195.text: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.

2196.text: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

2197.text: It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

2198.text: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

2199.text: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.

2200.text: It intimidates foes with intense gusts of flames and superheated air. Its quick nimbleness lets it dodge attacks even while scorching an enemy.

2201.text: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.

2202.text: It intimidates foes with the heat of its flames. The fire burns more strongly when it readies to fight.

2203.text: Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes.

2204.text: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

2205.text: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

2206.text: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.

2207.text: When heat from its body causes the air around it to shimmer, this is a sign that it is ready to battle.

2208.text: TYPHLOSION obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This POKéMON creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

2209.text: It can hide behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intense flames. TYPHLOSION create blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

2210.text: It attacks using blasts of fire. It creates heat shimmers with intense fire to hide itself.

2211.text: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.

2212.text: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

2213.text: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

2214.text: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.

2215.text: This rough critter chomps at any moving object it sees. Turning your back on it is not recommended.

2216.text: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer needs to be careful.

2217.text: It is small but rough and tough. It won’t hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

2218.text: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its Trainer must be careful.

2219.text: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

2220.text: The tips of its fangs are slanted backward. Once those fangs clamp down, the prey has no hope of escape.

2221.text: Once its jaws clamp down on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like fishhooks, they become irremovably embedded.

2222.text: It opens its huge jaws wide when attacking. If it loses any fangs while biting, they grow back in.

2223.text: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

2224.text: Once it bites down, it won’t let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.

2225.text: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

2226.text: Although it has a massive body, its powerful hind legs enable it to move quickly, even on the ground.

2227.text: FERALIGATR intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

2228.text: It opens its huge mouth to intimidate enemies. In battle, it runs using its thick and powerful hind legs to charge the foe with incredible speed.

2229.text: It is hard for it to support its weight out of water, so it sometimes gets down on all fours. But it moves fast.

2230.text: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

2231.text: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

2232.text: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

2233.text: They take turns standing guard when it is time to sleep. The sentry awakens the others if it senses danger. If one becomes separated, it turns sleepless with fear.

2234.text: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.

2235.text: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

2236.text: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.

2237.text: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.

2238.text: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

2239.text: It lives in narrow burrows that fit its slim body. The deeper the nests go, the more maze­ like they become.

2240.text: A FURRET has a very slim build. When under attack, it can squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, it is very nimble and fleet.

2241.text: There is no telling where the tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick and likes to chase RATTATA.

2242.text: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

2243.text: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.

2244.text: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

2245.text: It has an internal organ that senses the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, a HOOTHOOT begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.

2246.text: It always stands on one foot. Even when attacked, it does not brace itself using both feet.

2247.text: It switches its standing foot so quickly, it can’t be seen. It cries at the same time every day.

2248.text: It marks time precisely. Some countries consider it to be a wise friend, versed in the world’s ways.

2249.text: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.

2250.text: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.

2251.text: Every day, it tilts its head in the same rhythm. A long time ago, people raised these Pokémon to serve as clocks.

2252.text: It cries out at the same time every day. A long time ago, people cherished it and considered it a divine messenger sent to tell the time.

2253.text: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

2254.text: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.

2255.text: Its extremely soft feathers make no sound in flight. It silently sneaks up on prey without being detected.

2256.text: It unfailingly catches prey in darkness. NOCTOWL owe their success to superior vision that allows them to see in minimal light, and to their supple and silent wings.

2257.text: Its eyes are special. They can pick out objects as long as there is the tiniest amount of light.

2258.text: If it flips its head upside down, it’s a sign that it is engaged in very complex thinking.

2259.text: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

2260.text: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.

2261.text: With eyes that can see in pitch-darkness, it never lets its prey escape. Some even call it “the emperor of dark nights.”

2262.text: When it turns its head entirely upside down, you know it’s troubled by something. If you don’t leave it be, it will peck you.

2263.text: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

2264.text: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

2265.text: LEDYBA communicate using a fluid that they secrete from where the legs join the body. They are said to convey feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.

2266.text: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.

2267.text: When the weather turns cold, lots of LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.

2268.text: It is so timid, it can’t move if it isn’t with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.

2269.text: When the weather turns cold, lots of Ledyba gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.

2270.text: It is timid and clusters together with others. The fluid secreted by its feet indicates its location.

2271.text: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.

2272.text: They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on their backs differs slightly from one to another.

2273.text: They communicate with one another using bodily fluids that give off odors. When they’re angry, their odor smells sour.

2274.text: This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.

2275.text: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.

2276.text: In the daytime when it gets warm, it curls up inside a big leaf and drifts off into a deep slumber.

2277.text: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live many LEDIAN. For good reason, they use the light of the stars as energy.

2278.text: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.

2279.text: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.

2280.text: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.

2281.text: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as its energy.

2282.text: While it’s believed that starlight provides it with energy, this Pokémon also loves to eat berries. In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.

2283.text: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.

2284.text: It’s said that the patterns on its back are related to the stars in the night sky, but the details of that relationship remain unclear.

2285.text: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

2286.text: If prey becomes ensnared in its nest of spun string, it waits motionlessly until it becomes dark.

2287.text: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong silk. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.

2288.text: It spins a web using fine--but durable--thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.

2289.text: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

2290.text: The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokémon can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web’s strands.

2291.text: It waits intently until its preferred prey, Cutiefly, gets caught in its web. In fact, it’s quite a patient Pokémon.

2292.text: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

2293.text: With threads from its mouth, it fashions sturdy webs that won’t break even if you set a rock on them.

2294.text: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

2295.text: Rather than mak­ ing a nest in one specific spot, it wanders in search of food after darkness falls.

2296.text: ARIADOS’s feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This POKéMON constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.

2297.text: Its feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. It constricts its foe with thin and strong silk webbing.

2298.text: A single strand of a special string is endlessly spun out of its rear. The string leads back to its nest.

2299.text: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It’s hard to tell which end is which.

2300.text: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.

2301.text: Ariados’s feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokémon constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.

2302.text: There are some areas where people use the string Ariados spins for their own weaving. The resulting cloth is popular for its strength.

2303.text: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.

2304.text: Every night, it wanders around in search of prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing threads before it bites into them with its fangs.

2305.text: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

2306.text: As a result of its pursuit of faster, yet more silent flight, a new set of wings grew on its hind legs.

2307.text: CROBAT sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This POKéMON rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.

2308.text: Over the course of evolution, its hind legs turned into wings. By alternately resting its front and rear wings, it can fly all day without having to stop.

2309.text: Having four wings enables it to fly faster and more quietly. It turns active when the night comes.

2310.text: A Pokémon that gained vastly enhanced flying performance by having its legs turn into wings.

2311.text: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.

2312.text: The transformation of its legs into wings made it better at flying, but more clumsy at walking.

2313.text: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.

2314.text: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.

2315.text: If this Pokémon is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it’s proof that Crobat has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.

2316.text: Crobat sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This Pokémon rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.

2317.text: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can’t move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.

2318.text: Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites down on its prey before they realize what’s happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.

2319.text: Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark and sucks your blood, you won’t notice any pain or realize you’ve been bitten.

2320.text: It feeds on the blood of living people and Pokémon. If it can’t drink any blood for even a short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.

2321.text: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.

2322.text: This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully. Crobat can fly through cramped caves without needing to slow down.

2323.text: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.

2324.text: Chinchou blink their shining antennae at one another to claim their respective turf.

2325.text: When it senses danger, it discharges positive and negative electricity from its two antennae. It lives in depths beyond sunlight’s reach.

2326.text: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

2327.text: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.

2328.text: Chinchou lets loose positive and negative electrical charges from its two antennas to make its prey faint. This Pokémon flashes its electric lights to exchange signals with others.

2329.text: Chinchou’s two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This Pokémon’s cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.

2330.text: Its two antennae were originally fins. It discharges electricity to stun its prey before attacking.

2331.text: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

2332.text: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokémon for night fishing.

2333.text: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.

2334.text: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

2335.text: This POKéMON uses the bright part of its body, which changed from a dorsal fin, to lure prey.

2336.text: LANTURN is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This POKéMON produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.

2337.text: LANTURN is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this POKéMON’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.

2338.text: The light-emitting orbs on its back are very bright. They are formed from a part of its dorsal fin. This POKéMON illuminates the inky darkness of deep seas.

2339.text: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.

2340.text: LANTURN’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”

2341.text: Lanturn’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”

2342.text: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.

2343.text: Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This Pokémon produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.

2344.text: Lanturn is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this Pokémon’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.

2345.text: Should you peer into the ocean at night and see a light shining like the stars, that is Lanturn.

2346.text: When the bacteria living inside its antennae absorb Lanturn’s bodily fluids, a strong luminescent effect is produced.

2347.text: It lives far down in the depths of the ocean. It blinds its prey with light, using the moment they’re dazzled to swallow them whole.

2348.text: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.

2349.text: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

2350.text: It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.

2351.text: It is still inept at retaining electricity. When it is startled, it discharges power accidentally. It gets better at holding power as it grows older.

2352.text: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.

2353.text: It plays with others by touching tails and setting off sparks. This appears to be a test of courage.

2354.text: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.

2355.text: Pichu charges itself with electricity more easily on days with thunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static electricity coming off this Pokémon.

2356.text: When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with another Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this Pokémon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.

2357.text: It is not yet skilled at controlling electricity. If you take your eyes off it, it may shock itself.

2358.text: Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.

2359.text: It still can’t use electricity well. When it’s surprised or excited, it discharges electricity unintentionally.

2360.text: It has electric sacs in its cheeks. When they’re fully charged, Pichu plays very energetically.

2361.text: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.

2362.text: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.

2363.text: Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature, the Pokémon's handling of electricity is rather inept.

2364.text: If the impact site of a meteorite is found, this POKéMON is certain to be within the immediate area.

2365.text: On nights with many shooting stars, CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance until daybreak, when they quench their thirst with the morning dew.

2366.text: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.

2367.text: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.

2368.text: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It’s said to arrive riding on a shooting star.

2369.text: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.

2370.text: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!

2371.text: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst with the morning dew.

2372.text: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.

2373.text: Because of its silhouette, it’s believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.

2374.text: Said to have ridden here on a shooting star, Cleffa seem to appear in places where meteorites have struck in the past.

2375.text: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.

2376.text: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

2377.text: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

2378.text: IGGLYBUFF has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.

2379.text: Its soft and pliable body is very bouncy. When it sings continuously with all its might, its body steadily turns a deepening pink color.

2380.text: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously--anytime, anywhere.

2381.text: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.

2382.text: Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.

2383.text: Instead of walking with its short legs, it moves around by bouncing on its soft, tender body.

2384.text: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.

2385.text: Igglybuff’s vocal cords are not sufficiently developed. It would hurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This Pokémon gargles with freshwater from a clean stream.

2386.text: Igglybuff has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.

2387.text: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.

2388.text: It moves by bouncing along. As it moves a lot, it sweats, and its body gives off a sweet aroma.

2389.text: It’s always practicing its singing because it wants to improve. Even when it’s asleep, it keeps singing in its dreams!

2390.text: Left to its own devices, it will constantly practice singing. You should make it take a break so it doesn’t hurt its throat.

2391.text: Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body gives off a faint sweet smell.

2392.text: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.

2393.text: As its energy, TOGEPI uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and POKéMON. This POKéMON stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.

2394.text: As its energy, it uses the feelings of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and POKéMON. It stores up happy feelings in its shell, then shares them out.

2395.text: Its shell is said to be stuffed with happiness that it shares with kindhearted people.

2396.text: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

2397.text: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.

2398.text: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.

2399.text: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

2400.text: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.

2401.text: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

2402.text: Although it does not flap its wings very much, it can stay up in the air as it tags along after its trainer.

2403.text: It is said to be a POKéMON that brings good fortune. When it spots someone who is pure of heart, a TOGETIC appears and shares its happiness with that person.

2404.text: It is said to appear in front of kindly people to scatter a glowing down called “joy dust.”

2405.text: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kind- hearted people.

2406.text: Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.

2407.text: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

2408.text: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

2410.text: It runs up short trees that grow on the savanna to peck at new shoots. A NATU’s eyes look as if they are always observing something.

2413.text: Natu cannot fly because its wings are not yet fully grown. If your eyes meet with this Pokémon’s eyes, it will stare back intently at you. But if you move even slightly, it will hop away to safety.

2414.text: Natu has a highly developed jumping ability. The Pokémon flaps and leaps onto tree branches that are taller than grown-up people to pick at the tree’s new shoots.

2415.text: Although it still can’t fly, its jumping power is outstanding. It jumps way up into trees and plucks the buds from the branches.

2416.text: The look in its eyes gives the impression that it’s carefully observing you. If you approach it, Natu will hop away.

2417.text: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.

2418.text: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

2419.text: XATU stands rooted and still in one spot all day long. People believe that this POKéMON does so out of fear of the terrible things it has foreseen in the future.

2420.text: XATU is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical POKéMON out of their belief that XATU is in possession of the power to see into the future.

2421.text: It has the enigmatic power of foreseeing the future. Some people in different lands have long believed that XATU are emissaries from another world.

2422.text: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.

2423.text: Once it begins to meditate at sunrise, the entire day will pass before it will move again.

2424.text: Xatu stands rooted and still in one spot all day long. People believe that this Pokémon does so out of fear of the terrible things it has foreseen in the future.

2425.text: Xatu is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical Pokémon out of their belief that Xatu is in possession of the power to see into the future.

2426.text: It’s said that while this Pokémon has the power to predict the future, it’s not powerful enough to change the future it sees.

2427.text: While it can see the future, it has no desire to change it, which is probably why it remains motionless at all times.

2428.text: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

2429.text: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

2430.text: Its fluffy wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more energy is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.

2431.text: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.

2432.text: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.

2433.text: When cold weather increases static electricity, its wool doubles in size and the tip of its tail glows slightly.

2434.text: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

2435.text: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

2436.text: Mareep’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.

2437.text: Clothing made from Mareep’s fleece is easily charged with static electricity, so a special process is used on it.

2438.text: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.

2439.text: Because of its rubbery, electric­ ity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electric­ ity in its fur.

2440.text: FLAAFFY’s wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

2441.text: Its fleece quality changes to generate strong static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare, slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

2442.text: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.

2443.text: Not even downy wool will grow on its rubbery, nonconductive patches of skin that prevent electrical shock.

2444.text: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.

2445.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

2446.text: Flaaffy’s wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

2447.text: In the places on its body where fleece doesn’t grow, its skin is rubbery and doesn’t conduct electricity. Those spots are safe to touch.

2448.text: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

2449.text: When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the ocean's surface.

2450.text: It gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used its light to send signals back and forth with others far away.

2451.text: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.

2452.text: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail’s light.

2453.text: The tip of its tail shines so brightly it can be used to send sea-navigation beacons to distant foreign shores.

2454.text: The tail’s tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

2455.text: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémon to send signals back and forth with others far away.

2456.text: The light from its tail can be seen from space. This is why you can always tell exactly where it is, which is why it usually keeps the light off.

2457.text: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

2458.text: When these dance together, their petals rub against each other, making pretty, relaxing sounds.

2459.text: Its flower petals deepen in color through exposure to sunlight. When cloudy weather persists, it does a dance that is thought to be a ritual for summoning the sun.

2460.text: BELLOSSOM gather at times and seem to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

2461.text: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

2462.text: When Bellossom gets exposed to plenty of sunlight, the leaves ringing its body begin to spin around. This Pokémon’s dancing is renowned in the southern lands.

2463.text: A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this Pokémon closes its petals and goes to sleep.

2464.text: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

2465.text: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

2466.text: Its body is covered with water-repellent fur. Because of the fur, it can swim through water at high speed without being slowed by the water’s resistance.

2467.text: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow on river bottoms.

2468.text: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.

2469.text: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.

2470.text: The oil-filled end of its tail floats on water. It keeps Marill from drowning even in a strong current.

2471.text: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.

2472.text: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry, even when it plays in the water.

2473.text: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

2474.text: Marill’s oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water’s surface, it’s a sure indication that this Pokémon is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.

2475.text: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.

2476.text: This Pokémon uses its round tail as a float. The ball of Marill’s tail is filled with nutrients that have been turned into an oil.

2477.text: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.

2478.text: It lives in water virtually all day long. Its body color and pattern act as camouflage that makes it tough for enemies to spot in water.

2479.text: AZUMARILL’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this POKéMON can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.

2480.text: AZUMARILL can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning POKéMON. The air balloons enable the POKéMON in trouble to breathe.

2481.text: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.

2482.text: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.

2483.text: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.

2484.text: It can spend all day in water, since it can inhale and store a large volume of air.

2485.text: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

2486.text: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.

2487.text: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it’s in the water.

2488.text: Azumarill’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this Pokémon can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.

2489.text: Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pokémon. The air balloons enable the Pokémon in trouble to breathe.

2490.text: It spends most of its time in the water. On sunny days, Azumarill floats on the surface of the water and sunbathes.

2491.text: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.

2492.text: SUDOWOODO camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because the forelegs remain green throughout the year, the POKéMON is easily identified as a fake during the winter.

2493.text: It mimics a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. But since its forelegs remain green throughout the year, it is easily identified as a fake in the winter.

2494.text: Despite appearing to be a tree, its body is closer to rocks and stones. It is very weak to water.

2495.text: It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.

2496.text: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.

2497.text: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.

2498.text: Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain green throughout the year, the Pokémon is easily identified as a fake during the winter.

2499.text: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.

2500.text: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It’s a particular favorite among elderly people.

2501.text: It’s so popular with the elderly that there’s a magazine devoted to this Pokémon. Fans obsess over the particular length and angle of its arms.

2502.text: The result of its holding the same pose all the time is arms that have become supple yet strong.

2503.text: If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it’s a Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.

2504.text: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.

2505.text: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

2506.text: If POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL hear its echoing cry, they respond by gather­ ing from far and wide.

2508.text: The curled hair on its head proves its status as a king. It is said that the longer and curlier the hair, the more respect it earns from its peers.

2509.text: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make Poliwag obey.

2510.text: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.

2514.text: It’s the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.

2515.text: Although its cries sound like screams, a composer created a beautiful ballad that was influenced by the sounds.

2516.text: The longer and more luxurious the curled hair on its head, the greater the number of Poliwag and Poliwhirl that will obey it.

2517.text: At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by letting out cries that sound like shouting.

2518.text: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.

2519.text: It can be carried away on even the gentlest breeze. It may even float all the way to the next town.

2526.text: It blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees F. Because its flower’s blooming changes with the temperature, it is sometimes used as a thermometer.

2532.text: Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.

2533.text: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.

2545.text: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

2547.text: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.

2550.text: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. A year after a cold summer, their population explodes.

2554.text: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

2561.text: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

2562.text: It can see in all directions without moving its big eyes, helping it spot attackers and food right away.

2563.text: It can see 360 degrees without moving its eyes. It is a great flier capable of making sudden stops and turning midair to quickly chase down targeted prey.

2564.text: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.

2565.text: It can hover in one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.

2567.text: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won’t miss prey--even those behind it.

2571.text: A mucous membrane covers its body. Touching it barehanded will cause a shooting pain.

2573.text: It lives in cold water, half burying itself in mud at the bottom to sleep.

2574.text: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.

2576.text: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.

2577.text: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

2578.text: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

2579.text: A QUAGSIRE hunts by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in. Because it doesn’t move, it does not get very hungry.

2580.text: A dim-witted Pokémon. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head into boats or rocks while swimming.

2581.text: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.

2582.text: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river’s bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.

2583.text: This carefree Pokémon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

2584.text: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.

2585.text: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

2586.text: Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head on the river bottom as it swims but seems not to care.

2587.text: An ESPEON is extremely loyal to any TRAINER it considers to be worthy. It is said to have developed precognitive powers to protect its TRAINER from harm.

2588.text: Its fur has the look and feel of velvet. The orb on its forehead glows when it uses psycho-power.

2589.text: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.

2590.text: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.

2591.text: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.

2592.text: Its fur is so sensitive, it can feel minute shifts in the air and predict the weather...and its foes’ thoughts.

2593.text: Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said that this Pokémon developed its precognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.

2594.text: It can instantaneously sense its opponent’s movements by feeling air currents with its fine fur.

2595.text: Although it originally had no powers at all, people say its precognitive faculties were awakened by its need to protect itself.

2596.text: Psychic power builds up in the orb on its forehead as it bathes in the sunshine. Espeon is not good at battling at night.

2597.text: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.

2598.text: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.

2599.text: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people's thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.

2600.text: UMBREON evolved from exposure to the moon’s energy pulses. It lurks in darkness and waits for its foes to move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.

2601.text: When agitated, this Pokémon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.

2602.text: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.

2603.text: The light of the moon changed Eevee’s genetic structure. It lurks in darkness for prey.

2604.text: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it’s filled with a mysterious power.

2605.text: Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon’s waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.

2606.text: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its throat, and then eats it.

2607.text: This Pokémon is nocturnal. Even in total darkness, its large eyes can spot its prey clearly!

2608.text: It lurks in the dark of night looking for prey. At the moment it pounces, the rings on its body glow dimly but ominously.

2609.text: When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at its opponent’s eyes.

2610.text: On the night of a full moon, or when it gets excited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.

2611.text: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.

2612.text: MURKROW were feared as the alleged bearers of ill fortune. It shows strong interest in anything that sparkles. It will even try to steal rings from women.

2613.text: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.

2614.text: It appears near travelers to lure them into deep forests. It is said to carry misfortune.

2615.text: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.

2616.text: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.

2617.text: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. Murkrow and Meowth loot one another’s stashes.

2618.text: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

2619.text: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.

2620.text: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, “Get home before the Murkrow fly.”

2621.text: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it’s generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it’s close to.

2622.text: It has a weakness for shiny things. It’s been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

2623.text: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

2624.text: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant ”Workrum, Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.

2625.text: It has incredible intellect and in­ tuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

2626.text: Every time it ya­ wns, SHELLDER injects more poi­ son into it. The poison makes it more intelligent.

2627.text: SLOWKING undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this POKéMON apparently forgets everything it has learned if the SHELLDER on its head comes off.

2628.text: It undertakes research every day to solve the mysteries of the world. However, it apparently forgets everything if the SHELLDER on its head comes off.

2629.text: Being bitten by SHELLDER gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

2630.text: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

2631.text: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

2632.text: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke’s head and unlocked an extraordinary power.

2633.text: Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokémon apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.

2634.text: A poisonous bite reacted with its system, blessing it with the enhanced intellect of a genius. It has full control of its psychic powers.

2635.text: This Pokémon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: “When in doubt, ask Slowking.”

2636.text: It’s constantly coming up with new ideas that would change the world, but as soon as it hits upon a new idea, it forgets it.

2637.text: It’s called “the sage of the sea.” It engages in battles of wits with Oranguru, but the result is usually a draw.

2638.text: Miraculously, this former Slowpoke’s latent intelligence was drawn out when Shellder poison raced through its brain.

2639.text: Slowking can solve any problem presented to it, but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.

2640.text: It loves to watch people it's scar­ ed. It frightens them by screaming loudly or appear­ ing suddenly.

2641.text: MISDREAVUS frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The POKéMON apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.

2642.text: A MISDREAVUS frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. It apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fear of foes as its nutrition.

2643.text: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.

2644.text: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

2645.text: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

2646.text: It gets nourishment from fear that it absorbs into its red orbs. In daytime, it sleeps in darkness.

2647.text: It likes playing mischievous tricks, such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.

2648.text: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokémon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.

2649.text: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.

2650.text: If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a vacant room, it’s undoubtedly a bit of mischief from Misdreavus.

2651.text: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.

2652.text: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.

2653.text: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.

2654.text: Because different types of UNOWN exist, it is said that they must have a variety of abilities.

2655.text: This POKéMON is shaped like ancient text characters. Although research is ongoing, it is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various UNOWN.

2656.text: They seem to communicate among each other telepathically. They are always found stuck on walls.

2657.text: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

2658.text: When alone, nothing happens. However, if there are two or more, an odd power is said to emerge.

2659.text: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

2660.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

2661.text: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

2662.text: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

2663.text: In order to con­ ceal its black tail, it lives in a dark cave and only moves about at night.

2664.text: If two or more WOBBUFFET meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other’s endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food. TRAINERS need to beware of this habit.

2665.text: WOBBUFFET does nothing but endure attacks - it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the POKéMON will try to take the foe with it using DESTINY BOND.

2666.text: Usually docile, a WOBBUFFET strikes back ferociously if its black tail is attacked. It makes its lair in caves where it waits for nightfall.

2667.text: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.

2668.text: If two or more Wobbuffet meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other’s endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food. Trainers need to beware of this habit.

2669.text: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.

2670.text: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.

2671.text: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

2672.text: When it is in danger, its tail uses some sort of mysterious powers to drive away the enemy.

2673.text: A GIRAFARIG is an herbivore--it eats grass and tree shoots. While it is eating, its tail makes chewing and swallowing motions as if it were also eating.

2674.text: Its tail also has a small brain. It bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on it from behind.

2675.text: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.

2676.text: The head on its tail contains a small brain. It can instinctively fight even while facing backward.

2677.text: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn’t need to sleep.

2678.text: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.

2679.text: Girafarig’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.

2680.text: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

2681.text: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.

2682.text: A PINECO hangs from a tree branch and waits for prey. While eating, if it is disturbed by someone shaking its tree, it falls on the ground and suddenly explodes.

2683.text: It hangs and waits for flying insect prey to come near. It does not move about much on its own.

2684.text: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn’t bother it.

2685.text: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

2686.text: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.

2687.text: Motionless, it hangs from trees, waiting for its bug Pokémon prey to come to it. Its favorite in Alola is Cutiefly.

2688.text: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.

2689.text: Usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.

2690.text: It keeps itself inside its steel shell. The shell is opened when it is catching prey, but it is so quick that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.

2691.text: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
