2692.text: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

2693.text: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

2694.text: Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokémon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.

2695.text: When something approaches it, it fires off fragments of its steel shell in attack. This is not a conscious action but a conditioned reflex.

2696.text: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

2697.text: It hides deep inside caves where no light ever reaches it and remains virtually motionless there.

2698.text: DUNSPARCE has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.

2699.text: Its drill-tipped tail is used to burrow into the ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.

2700.text: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.

2701.text: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

2702.text: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.

2703.text: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

2704.text: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokémon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.

2705.text: It travels by digging through the ground. Diglett and Dunsparce share one another’s tunnels happily.

2706.text: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.

2707.text: This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.

2708.text: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

2709.text: It builds its nest on a steep cliff. When it is done gliding, it hops along the ground back to its nest.

2710.text: It glides without making a single sound. It grasps the face of its foe using its hind and large front claws, then stabs with its poison barb.

2711.text: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey’s face.

2712.text: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.

2713.text: It clamps on to its chosen prey then jabs the stinger on its tail into the prey while it’s stunned with surprise.

2714.text: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

2715.text: It flies straight at its target’s face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

2716.text: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

2717.text: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.

2718.text: The many small metal particles that cover this POKéMON's body reflect bright light well.

2719.text: STEELIX live even further underground than ONIX. This POKéMON is known to dig toward the earth’s core, reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

2720.text: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.

2721.text: It’s said that if an ONIX lives for 100 years, its composition becomes diamondlike as it evolves into a STEELIX.

2722.text: The iron it ingested with the soil it swallowed transformed its body and made it harder than diamonds.

2723.text: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

2724.text: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.

2725.text: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth’s core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

2726.text: It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.

2727.text: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

2728.text: This Pokémon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.

2729.text: In truth, it is a cowardly POKéMON. It growls eagerly in order to hide its fear from its opponent.

2730.text: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, it sends smaller POKéMON scurrying in terror. The SNUBBULL does seem a little sad at making its foes flee.

2731.text: Although it looks frightening, it is actually kind and affectionate. It is very popular among women.

2732.text: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.

2733.text: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.

2734.text: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, Snubbull sends smaller Pokémon scurrying away in terror. However, this Pokémon seems a little sad at making its foes flee.

2735.text: Despite its intimidating face, it’s quite cowardly. Its desperate attempts to appear threatening make it popular with people.

2736.text: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

2737.text: It grows close to others easily and is also easily spoiled. The disparity between its face and its actions makes many young people wild about it.

2738.text: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

2739.text: GRANBULL has a particularly well- developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the POKéMON to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.

2740.text: It has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The huge fangs are heavy, causing it to tilt its head. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite.

2741.text: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.

2742.text: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its bite is powerful.

2743.text: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

2744.text: It can make most any Pokémon run away simply by opening its mouth wide to reveal its big fangs.

2745.text: While it has powerful jaws, it doesn’t care for disputes, so it rarely has a chance to display their might.

2746.text: Granbull has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the Pokémon to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.

2747.text: Its well-developed lower jaw and heavy fangs are its weapons. As long as it’s not provoked, it rarely bites.

2748.text: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

2749.text: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

2750.text: QWILFISH sucks in water, inflating itself. This POKéMON uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.

2751.text: A QWILFISH uses the pressure of water it swallows to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming to be somewhat challenging.

2752.text: It shoots the poison spines on its body in all directions. Its round form makes it a poor swimmer.

2753.text: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

2754.text: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.

2755.text: When faced with a larger opponent, it swallows as much water as it can to match the opponent’s size.

2756.text: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.

2757.text: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

2758.text: A SCIZOR has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. It flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.

2759.text: It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.

2760.text: Its wings are not used for flying. They are flapped at high speed to adjust its body temperature.

2761.text: It raises its pincers with eyelike markings for intimidation. It also swings them down dangerously.

2762.text: This Pokémon’s pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object it gets ahold of into bits.

2763.text: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.

2764.text: Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokémon flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.

2765.text: It uses its wings to adjust its body temperature. Otherwise, its metal body would become too hot and melt in the heat of battle.

2766.text: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokémon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.

2767.text: Its body is like steel. Its tough, heavy pincers are more suited to smashing enemies than grabbing them.

2768.text: Once it has identified something as an enemy, it will continue beating them with its steel-hard pincers until there’s nothing left but scraps.

2769.text: Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizor’s body weight. A single swing of one of these pincers will crush a boulder completely.

2770.text: Though its body is slim, Scizor has tremendous attacking power. Even Scizor’s muscles are made of metal.

2771.text: Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.

2772.text: The fluid secreted by its toes carves holes in rocks for nesting and can be mixed with BERRIES to make a drink.

2773.text: A SHUCKLE hides under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its shell while eating stored berries. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.

2774.text: The BERRIES it stores in its vaselike shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.

2775.text: The berries it stores in its vase-like shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.

2776.text: It stores berries in its shell. The berries eventually ferment to become delicious juices.

2777.text: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.

2778.text: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

2779.text: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

2780.text: They gather in forests seeking the sweet sap of trees. It is completely clad in a steel-hard shell. It is proud of its horn, which it uses to fling foes.

2781.text: Usually docile, but if disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.

2782.text: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It’s strong enough to hurl foes.

2783.text: With powerful legs and claws, it generates enough power to hurl foes over great distances.

2784.text: It loves sweet honey. To keep all the honey to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

2785.text: No matter how heavy its opponents, it flings them far away with its prized horn.

2786.text: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies’ bellies, then lifts and throws them.

2787.text: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.

2788.text: Heracross charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe’s grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. This Pokémon even has enough power to topple a massive tree.

2789.text: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.

2790.text: It’s proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it’s always fighting with.

2791.text: It roams through forests searching for sweet nectar. Although it boasts fantastic physical strength, it’s not that good at flying.

2792.text: Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking through forests for it. The Pokémon uses its two antennae to pick up scents as it searches.

2793.text: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.

2794.text: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

2795.text: This cunning POKéMON hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

2796.text: A SNEASEL scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. It seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.

2797.text: It is extremely vicious and will not stop attacking until its foe is incapable of moving.

2798.text: Vicious in nature, it drives PIDGEY from their nests and scavenges any leftovers it can find.

2799.text: A smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.

2800.text: A smart and sneaky Pokémon, it makes its opponents flinch by suddenly showing the claws hidden in its paws.

2801.text: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

2802.text: Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. This Pokémon seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.

2803.text: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.

2804.text: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokémon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.

2805.text: It blends into the dark of night to ambush its prey. Sneasel will attack Sandshrew, but its hard skin can cause Sneasel’s claws to snap off.

2806.text: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.

2807.text: It has a cunning yet savage disposition. It waits for parents to leave their nests, and then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.

2808.text: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.

2809.text: It always licks honey. Its palm tastes sweet because of all the honey it has absorbed.

2810.text: It licks its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. A TEDDIURSA makes its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by BEEDRILL.

2811.text: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every set of paws tastes unique.

2812.text: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they’re soaked with honey.

2813.text: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

2814.text: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

2815.text: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.

2816.text: In the forests inhabited by URSARING, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This POKéMON walks through its forest gathering food every day.

2817.text: In forests, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where an URSARING gathers food. It walks through its forest collecting food every day.

2818.text: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen berries.

2819.text: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.

2820.text: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.

2821.text: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.

2822.text: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

2823.text: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.

2824.text: These group to­ gether in areas that are hotter than normal. If it cools off, its skin hardens.

2825.text: SLUGMA does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this POKéMON’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

2826.text: It is a species of POKéMON that lives in volcanic areas. If its body cools, its skin hardens and immobilizes it. To avoid that, it sleeps near magma.

2827.text: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.

2828.text: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

2829.text: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

2830.text: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma’s circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.

2831.text: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

2832.text: MAGCARGO’s shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile - just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This POKéMON returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.

2833.text: MAGCARGO’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees F. Water is vaporized on contact. If this POKéMON is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

2834.text: The shell on its back is made of hardened magma. Tens of thousands of years spent living in volcanic craters have turned MAGCARGO’s bodies into magma.

2835.text: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.

2836.text: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees F. Flames spout from gaps in its hardened shell.

2837.text: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

2838.text: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

2839.text: Magcargo’s shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile—just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This Pokémon returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.

2840.text: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

2841.text: It uses the tip of its nose to dig for food. Its nose is so tough that even frozen ground poses no problem.

2842.text: It roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under dried grass. It occasionally roots out hot springs.

2843.text: It loves eating mushrooms that grow under dead grass. It also finds hot springs while foraging.

2844.text: It has a very sensitive nose. It can locate mushrooms, berries, and even hot springs buried under ice.

2845.text: Rooting the tip of its snout into the ground, it searches for food. Sometimes it even digs up a hot spring.

2846.text: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokémon occasionally roots out hot springs.

2847.text: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

2848.text: If it smells something enticing, it dashes off headlong to find the source of the aroma.

2849.text: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.

2850.text: PILOSWINE is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This POKéMON uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

2851.text: A PILOSWINE is covered by a thick coat of long hair for enduring freezing cold. It uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

2852.text: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.

2853.text: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is strong against the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.

2854.text: With its excellent sense of smell, it’s even able to find mushrooms that are buried under frozen ground.

2855.text: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

2856.text: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

2857.text: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

2858.text: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.

2859.text: The long fur of this Pokémon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokémon's white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.

2860.text: The points on its head absorb nutrients from clean water. They cannot survive in polluted water.

2861.text: CORSOLA’s branches glitter very beautifully in seven colors when they catch sunlight. If any branch breaks off, this POKéMON grows it back in just one night.

2862.text: Clusters of CORSOLA congregate in warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller POKéMON. When the water temperature falls, this POKéMON migrates to the southern seas.

2863.text: CORSOLA live in warm southern seas. If the sea becomes polluted, the beautiful coral stalks become discolored and crumble away in tatters.

2864.text: In a south-sea nation, the people live in communities that are built on groups of these Pokémon.

2865.text: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.

2866.text: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.

2867.text: They prefer unpolluted southern seas. Their coral branches lose their color and deteriorate in dirty water.

2868.text: Corsola’s branches glitter very beautifully in seven colors when they catch sunlight. If any branch breaks off, this Pokémon grows it back in just one night.

2869.text: Clusters of Corsola congregate in warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller Pokémon. When the water temperature falls, this Pokémon migrates to the southern seas.

2870.text: Coral branches grow from its head. They break off quite easily, but they grow back in about three days.

2871.text: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.

2872.text: The pink of Corsola that live in Alola is deep and vibrant, thanks to seas filled with nutrition.

2873.text: In Alola, where their natural enemies Mareanie are plentiful, many Corsola have stubby branches on their heads.

2874.text: It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.

2875.text: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.

2876.text: To escape from an attacker, it may shoot water out of its mouth, then use that force to swim backward.

2877.text: REMORAID sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this POKéMON travels downstream from rivers.

2878.text: A REMORAID uses its abdominal muscles to forcefully expel swallowed water, then shoot down flying prey. When evolution approaches, it travels down rivers.

2879.text: It squirts water forcefully from its mouth to shoot down flying prey.

2880.text: It clings to MANTINE to feed on the big Pokémon’s scraps. This is an adaptation to avoid foes.

2881.text: It forcefully squirts water. The water jet never misses prey even if the Remoraid is deep in the sea.

2882.text: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike moving prey from more than 300 feet away.

2883.text: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pokémon travels downstream from rivers.

2884.text: This Pokémon clings to Mantine and shares in its prosperity. When its Mantine is attacked, Remoraid will fight alongside it!

2885.text: Also known as the “sniper of the seas,” its water gun can hit prey without fail from over 300 feet away.

2886.text: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.

2887.text: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine’s underside to scavenge for leftovers.

2888.text: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.

2889.text: Its instinct is to bury itself in holes. It often steals the nesting holes of others to sleep in them.

2890.text: OCTILLERY grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This POKéMON tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, OCTILLERY spews ink to escape.

2891.text: It ensnares its foe with its suction- cupped tentacles before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, it spews ink to escape.

2892.text: It lives in the gaps of boulders and in holes on the seafloor. Its suction cups grip prey tightly.

2893.text: It obscures its foe’s vision by spitting a cloud of murky ink. It makes its nest among boulders.

2894.text: It instinctively sneaks into rocky holes. If it gets sleepy, it steals the nest of a fellow OCTILLERY.

2895.text: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.

2896.text: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.

2897.text: The ink it spits when escaping is special. It contains a substance that dulls the sense of smell, so Pokémon with keen noses get lost.

2898.text: It usually sleeps in caves. The pitch-black ink that Octillery spits is also used for cooking.

2899.text: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

2900.text: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

2901.text: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.

2902.text: It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.

2903.text: DELIBIRD carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of Mt. Everest thanks to one of these POKéMON sharing its food.

2904.text: It carries food bundled up in its tail. There was a famous explorer who managed to scale Mt. Everest thanks to a DELIBIRD sharing its food.

2905.text: It nests at the edge of sharp cliffs. It spends all day carrying food to its awaiting chicks.

2906.text: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.

2907.text: It carries food all day long. When someone is lost in the mountains, it shares that food.

2908.text: Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the world’s highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokémon sharing its food.

2909.text: Although it naturally prefers colder locales, Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the heat to a certain extent.

2910.text: It shares its food with people who are stranded. Because Delibird is omnivorous, sometimes it gives those people bug Pokémon.

2911.text: It wraps food in its tail to carry it around. The Delibird with the biggest tail is the boss of the flock!

2912.text: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.

2913.text: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.

2914.text: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if REMORAID attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.

2915.text: It swims along freely, eating things that swim into its mouth. Its whole body is very coarse.

2916.text: On sunny days, schools of MANTINE can be seen elegantly leaping over the waves. It is not bothered by the REMORAID that hitches rides.

2917.text: When the waves are calm, one may encounter a swarm of MANTINE swimming as if they are in flight.

2918.text: It swims elegantly, mindless of REMORAID hitching on to its broad fins. It has a docile nature.

2919.text: Swimming freely in open seas, it may fly out of the water and over the waves if it builds up enough speed.

2920.text: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can fly over 300 feet out of the water from the surface of the ocean.

2921.text: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

2922.text: On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea’s waves. This Pokémon is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.

2923.text: Postcards and posters featuring Mantine leaping elegantly above the waves are popular souvenirs of Alola.

2924.text: Many people have taken up surfing because they admire how magnificently Mantine swims.

2925.text: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

2926.text: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.

2927.text: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

2928.text: The feathers that it sheds are very sharp. It is said that people once used the feathers as swords.

2929.text: A POKéMON that has a body and wings of steel. People in the past used feathers fallen from SKARMORY to make swords and knives.

2930.text: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.

2931.text: Its heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.

2932.text: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.

2933.text: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.

2934.text: Skarmory is entirely encased in hard, protective armor. This Pokémon flies at close to 190 mph. It slashes foes with its wings that possess swordlike cutting edges.

2935.text: Skarmory’s steel wings become tattered and bashed in from repeated battles. Once a year, the battered wings grow back completely, restoring the cutting edges to their pristine state.

2936.text: Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin and sharp. In times long past, warriors used them as swords.

2937.text: Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather easily. So on rainy days, this Pokémon prefers to stay put in its nest.

2938.text: The wing feathers it sheds can be processed and made into knives whose sharpness is recognized by the finest chefs.

2939.text: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour!

2940.text: The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.

2941.text: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

2942.text: HOUNDOUR communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This POKéMON’s remarkable teamwork is simply unparalleled.

2943.text: It conveys its feelings using different cries. It works in a pack to cleverly take down prey.

2944.text: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

2945.text: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

2946.text: Around dawn, its ominous howl echoes through the area to announce that this is its territory.

2947.text: To corner prey, they check each other’s location using barks that only they can understand.

2948.text: Houndour hunt as a coordinated pack. They communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This Pokémon’s remarkable teamwork is unparalleled.

2949.text: It cooperates with others skillfully. When it becomes your partner, it’s very loyal to you as its Trainer and will obey your orders.

2950.text: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.

2951.text: The pungent- smelling flame that shoots from its mouth results from toxins burn­ ing in its body.

2952.text: In a HOUNDOOM pack, the one with its horns raked sharply towards the back serves a leadership role. These POKéMON choose their leader by fighting amongst themselves.

2953.text: In a HOUNDOOM pack, the one with its horns raked sharply back serves a leadership role. They choose their leader by fighting among themselves.

2954.text: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

2955.text: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.

2956.text: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.

2957.text: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

2958.text: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply toward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokémon choose their leader by fighting among themselves.

2959.text: They spew flames mixed with poison to finish off their opponents. They divvy up their prey evenly among the members of their pack.

2960.text: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

2961.text: KINGDRA lives at extreme ocean depths that are otherwise uninhabited. It has long been believed that the yawning of this POKéMON creates spiraling ocean currents.

2962.text: KINGDRA sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the POKéMON is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.

2963.text: It sleeps quietly, deep on the seafloor. When it comes up to the surface, it creates a huge whirlpool that can swallow even ships.

2964.text: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.

2965.text: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

2966.text: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

2967.text: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life-forms can survive.

2968.text: Kingdra lives at extreme ocean depths that are otherwise uninhabited. It has long been believed that the yawning of this Pokémon creates spiraling ocean currents.

2969.text: Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the Pokémon is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.

2970.text: With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokémon will show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra and a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.

2971.text: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been given to royalty as gifts.

2972.text: During the desert­ ed morning hours, it comes ashore where it deftly uses its trunk to take a shower.

2973.text: PHANPY’s big ears serve as broad fans. When it becomes hot, it flaps the ears busily to cool down. Even the young are very strong.

2974.text: It swings its long snout around playfully, but because it is so strong, that can be dangerous.

2975.text: As a sign of affection, it bumps with its snout. However, it is so strong, it may send you flying.

2976.text: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

2977.text: For its nest, Phanpy digs a vertical pit in the ground at the edge of a river. It marks the area around its nest with its trunk to let the others know that the area has been claimed.

2978.text: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

2979.text: Because this POKéMON's skin is so tough, a normal attack won't even leave a scratch on it.

2980.text: DONPHAN’s favorite attack is curling its body into a ball, then charging at its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this POKéMON can’t stop very easily.

2981.text: If DONPHAN were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the POKéMON helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

2982.text: A DONPHAN is so strong it can easily haul a dump truck. Its hide has toughened to a rock-hard state. An ordinary sort of attack won’t even leave a scratch.

2983.text: It attacks by curling up then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.

2984.text: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

2985.text: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

2986.text: Donphan’s favorite attack is curling its body into a ball, then charging at its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this Pokémon can’t stop very easily.

2987.text: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

2988.text: This manmade POKéMON evolved from the latest technology. It may have unprog­ rammed reactions.

2989.text: It was created by humans using the power of science. It has been given artificial intelligence that enables it to learn new gestures and emotions on its own.

2990.text: This upgraded version of PORYGON is designed for space exploration. It can’t fly, however.

2991.text: It was upgraded to enable the exploration of other planets. However, it failed to measure up.

2992.text: Further research enhanced its abilities. Sometimes, it may exhibit motions that were not programmed.

2993.text: With planetary development software installed, it became capable of working in space.

2994.text: Porygon2 was created by humans using the power of science. The man-made Pokémon has been endowed with artificial intelligence that enables it to learn new gestures and emotions on its own.

2995.text: For the purposes of planetary development, Porygon was updated with the most cutting-edge technology available.

2996.text: Porygon was updated to a new version in readiness for planetary development. But that dream remains unrealized as yet.

2997.text: AI has been installed in it. It learns various things all on its own, but it even remembers things it doesn’t need to know.

2998.text: Even though it doesn’t die in the vacuum of space, it can’t move around very well in zero gravity.

2999.text: This is a Porygon that was updated with special data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about many different subjects all on its own.

3000.text: After artificial intelligence was implemented in Porygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange language that only other Porygon2 understand.

3001.text: A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.

3002.text: The round balls found on the fallen antlers can be ground into a powder that aids in sleeping.

3003.text: Those who stare at its antlers will gradually lose control of their senses and be unable to stand.

3004.text: Staring at its antlers creates an odd sensation as if one were being drawn into their centers.

3005.text: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

3006.text: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

3007.text: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.

3008.text: The color of the mysterious fluid secreted from its tail is predeter­ mined for each SMEARGLE.

3009.text: A SMEARGLE marks its territory using a fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. About 5,000 different marks left by this POKéMON have been found.

3010.text: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.

3011.text: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.

3012.text: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

3013.text: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pokémon have been found.

3014.text: The unique creations produced by each Smeargle are painted using the fluid that oozes from its tail. This is how it marks its territory.

3015.text: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.

3016.text: The fluid of Smeargle’s tail secretions changes in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon’s emotions change.

3017.text: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

3018.text: TYROGUE become stressed out if they do not get to train every day. When raising this POKéMON, the TRAINER must establish a regular training schedule.

3019.text: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.

3020.text: To brush up on its fighting skills, it will challenge anyone. It has a very strong competitive spirit.

3021.text: Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.

3022.text: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

3023.text: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

3024.text: HITMONTOP spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The POKéMON travels faster spinning than it does walking.

3025.text: Its technique of kicking while spinning is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense. HITMONTOP travel faster spinning than they do walking.

3026.text: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dance-like kicks, you may get drilled hard.

3027.text: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.

3028.text: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than you’d like.

3029.text: Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokémon travels faster spinning than it does walking.

3030.text: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

3031.text: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.

3032.text: The sensitivity of its lips develops most quickly. It uses them to try to identify unknown objects.

3033.text: It actively runs about, but also falls often. Whenever it falls, it will check its reflection on a lake’s surface to make sure its face hasn’t become dirty.

3034.text: It always rocks its head slowly backwards and forwards as if it is trying to kiss someone.

3035.text: Its lips are the most sensitive part of its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.

3036.text: It tests everything by touching with its lips, which remember what it likes and dislikes.

3037.text: Smoochum actively runs about, but also falls quite often. Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its face hasn’t become dirty.

3038.text: When it examines things, before touching them with its hands, it makes lip contact and then diligently licks all the dirt off its lips.

3039.text: Highly perceptive sensors, Smoochum’s lips are kept moist by its daily application of tree sap.

3040.text: If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.

3041.text: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.

3042.text: It loves violent thunder. The space between its horns flickers bluish- white when it is charging energy.

3043.text: ELEKID stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this POKéMON begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.

3044.text: If it touches metal and discharges the electricity it has stored in its body, an ELEKID begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.

3045.text: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.

3046.text: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pokémon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.

3047.text: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.

3048.text: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can’t store the energy it makes.

3049.text: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.

3050.text: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.

3051.text: When it’s in a house, electrical outlets serve as its baby bottles. It sucks down electricity.

3052.text: This Pokémon is constantly fighting with Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity. It’s a pretty even match.

3053.text: When it hears the crash of thunder, Elekid’s mood improves. It can be useful to record that sound and play it when Elekid’s feeling down.

3054.text: When its horns shine a bluish white, that’s the sign it’s fully charged. You’ll get a shocking jolt if you touch it!

3055.text: When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.

3056.text: It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.

3057.text: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.

3058.text: It naturally spits an 1100-degree flame. It is said when many appear, it heralds a volcanic eruption.

3059.text: If a MAGBY is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.

3060.text: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees F. It is healthy if it is breathing yellow flames.

3061.text: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble from its mouth and nostrils.

3062.text: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don’t underestimate it.

3063.text: It’s small, but its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. Embers escape its mouth and nose when it breathes.

3064.text: Its magma-like blood circulates throughout its body. Its body’s heat can top 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

3065.text: Magby’s state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokémon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.

3066.text: Many of these Pokémon can be seen in areas with volcanic activity. Feeding can get them so excited, they exhale flames of 1,100 degrees F.

3067.text: A famous potter lives with a Magby. Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.

3068.text: When flames drip from its nose, that means it has a cold. Have it lie down for a nice rest in some magma.

3069.text: Its body temperature is always around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. If Magby falls into a small- enough pond, the whole thing will dry up.

3070.text: This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.

3071.text: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.

3072.text: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.

3073.text: In order to milk a MILTANK, one must have a knack for rhythmically pull­ ing up and down on its udders.

3074.text: It gives over five gallons of milk daily. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can’t drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.

3075.text: If it has just had a baby, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.

3076.text: It is said that kids who drink Miltank’s milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

3077.text: If it is around babies, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.

3078.text: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.

3079.text: Miltank gives over five gallons of milk on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can’t drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.

3080.text: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank’s.

3081.text: Most people raise it for its milk, but it’s quite tough and strong, so it’s also well suited for battle.

3082.text: It produces over five gallons of milk a day. The higher the quality of the pastures it lives in, the richer and tastier its milk becomes.

3083.text: Its milk is delicious and chock-full of nutrients. However, if you drink too much, it could make your stomach hurt, so be careful.

3084.text: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.

3085.text: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.

3086.text: It has a very com­ passionate nature. If it sees a sick POKéMON, it will nurse the sufferer back to health.

3087.text: Biting into one of the delicious eggs that BLISSEY provides will make everyone around smile with joy.

3088.text: BLISSEY senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this POKéMON will rush over to the sad person, however far they may be, to share an egg of happiness that brings a smile to any face.

3089.text: If it senses sadness with its fluffy fur, a BLISSEY will rush over to the sad person, however far away, to share an egg of happiness that brings a smile to any face.

3090.text: It is a Pokémon that delivers happiness. Eating its egg is said to make one kind to everyone.

3091.text: Anyone who takes even one taste of BLISSEY’s egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.

3092.text: It has a very compassionate nature. If it sees a sick Pokémon, it will nurse the sufferer back to health.

3093.text: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

3094.text: This kindhearted Pokémon nurses sick Pokémon to health. It senses feelings of sadness.

3095.text: Blissey senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this Pokémon will rush over to a sad person, no matter how far away, to share a Lucky Egg that brings a smile to any face.

3096.text: Even the most ferocious Pokémon become calm when they eat Blissey’s egg, which is said to be filled with happiness.

3097.text: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokémon.

3098.text: Their eggs are such a delicacy that some say eating one will bring you happiness. These eggs fetch the highest prices on the market.

3099.text: This Pokémon is overflowing with love. Only Chansey that share a strong bond with their Trainer can evolve, so people say.

3100.text: Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokémon, it will share its egg and offer its care until the other Pokémon is all better.

3101.text: Blissey lays mysterious eggs that are filled with happiness. It’s said that anyone who eats a Blissey egg will start acting kindly to all others.

3102.text: A kindhearted Pokémon that will care for any sick person or Pokémon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.

3103.text: A Pokémon that races across the land while barking a cry that sounds like crashing thunder.

3104.text: It is said to have fallen with lightning. It can fire thunderbolts from the rain clouds on its back.

3105.text: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

3106.text: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

3107.text: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

3108.text: This brawny POKéMON courses around the earth, spouting flames hotter than a volcano's magma.

3109.text: ENTEI embodies the passion of magma. This POKéMON is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

3110.text: ENTEI embodies the passion of magma. It is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It blasts fire that consumes all that it touches.

3111.text: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to contain its sheer power, it races headlong around the land.

3112.text: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.

3113.text: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

3114.text: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

3115.text: This divine POKéMON blows around the world, always in search of a pure reservoir.

3116.text: SUICUNE embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gliding elegance. It has the power to purify dirty water.

3117.text: This Pokémon races across the land. It is said that north winds will somehow blow whenever it appears.

3118.text: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

3119.text: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

3120.text: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

3121.text: Born deep under­ ground, this POKéMON becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

3122.text: A LARVITAR is born deep under the ground. It must eat its way through the soil above and reach the surface for it to see its parents’ faces.

3123.text: It is born deep underground. It can’t emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.

3124.text: A Pokémon that eats soil. Once it has eaten a large mountain, it goes to sleep so it can grow.

3125.text: Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this Pokémon must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.

3126.text: Born underground, it eats its way through dirt to the surface, where its parents are. It doesn’t deal well with the bright light it finds there.

3127.text: Raised on nutrients it finds in the dirt, it eats roughly a mountain’s worth of dirt before it becomes a pupa.

3128.text: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

3129.text: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

3130.text: A PUPITAR creates a gas inside its body that it ejects under compression to propel itself like a jet. Its body can withstand a collision with solid steel.

3131.text: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

3132.text: Its body is as hard as bedrock. By venting pressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.

3133.text: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

3134.text: Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.

3135.text: This troublesome Pokémon can’t wait to evolve, so it relieves its stress by wildly propelling itself around using compressed gas.

3136.text: This dangerous pupa thrashes about. Its shell is as hard as bedrock, containing its gradually forming new body within.

3137.text: Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely. Hard and fast, it has outstanding destructive power.

3138.text: It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.

3139.text: TYRANITAR is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This POKéMON wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

3140.text: A TYRANITAR is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. It roams in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

3141.text: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It has an insolent nature that makes it not care about others.

3142.text: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.

3143.text: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

3144.text: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

3145.text: It wanders through the mountains seeking opponents to fight. If it finds an opponent that’s not worthy, Tyranitar ignores it and wanders on.

3146.text: This Pokémon is a mobile disaster, leaving mountains crumbled and houses destroyed in its wake.

3147.text: Its body can’t be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.

3148.text: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.

3149.text: It has an incred­ ible ability to calm raging sto­ rms. It is said that LUGIA appears when storms start.

3150.text: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea because its powers are too strong.

3151.text: It sleeps in a deep-sea trench. If it flaps its wings, it is said to cause a 40-day storm.

3152.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

3153.text: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

3154.text: Its feathers--which glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light--are thought to bring joy. It is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

3155.text: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world’s skies continuously on its magnificent, seven-colored wings.

3156.text: Its feathers are in seven colors. It is said that anyone seeing it is promised eternal happiness.

3157.text: A legend says that its body glows in seven colors. A rainbow is said to form behind it when it flies.

3158.text: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.

3159.text: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

3160.text: This POKéMON wan­ ders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

3161.text: Revered as a guardian of the forest, CELEBI appears wherever beautiful forests exist.

3162.text: When CELEBI disappears deep in a forest, it is said to leave behind an egg it brought from the future.

3163.text: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

3164.text: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

3165.text: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

3166.text: This Pokémon has the ability to move through time. Records describing it as a forest deity can be found from many different eras.

3167.text: This Pokémon traveled through time to come from the future. It bolsters grass and trees with its own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.

3168.text: TREECKO has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This POKéMON attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.

3169.text: TREECKO is cool, calm, and collected - it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this POKéMON, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

3170.text: It makes its nest in a giant tree in the forest. It ferociously guards against anything nearing its territory. It is said to be the protector of the forest’s trees.

3171.text: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

3172.text: It quickly scales even vertical walls. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day’s weather.

3173.text: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

3174.text: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.

3175.text: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

3176.text: Leaves grow out of this POKéMON’s body. They help obscure a GROVYLE from the eyes of its enemies while it is in a thickly overgrown forest.

3177.text: It leaps from tree branch to tree branch quite swiftly. It shows astounding agility.

3178.text: Its strongly developed thigh muscles give it astounding agility and jumping performance.

3179.text: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

3180.text: The leaves growing out of Grovyle’s body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokémon is a master at climbing trees in jungles.

3181.text: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

3182.text: In the jungle, its power is without equal. This POKéMON carefully grows trees and plants. It regulates its body temperature by basking in sunlight.

3183.text: The leaves on its forelegs are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike.

3184.text: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.

3185.text: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

3186.text: The leaves growing on Sceptile’s body are very sharp edged. This Pokémon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.

3187.text: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

3188.text: TORCHIC has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug - it will be glowing with warmth. This POKéMON is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

3189.text: If attacked, it strikes back by spitting balls of fire it forms in its stomach. A TORCHIC dislikes darkness because it can’t see its surroundings.

3190.text: Inside its body is a place where it keeps a small flame. Hug it! It will be as warm as a hot-water bottle.

3191.text: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.

3192.text: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

3193.text: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.

3194.text: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

3195.text: It lashes out with 10 kicks per second. Its strong fighting instinct compels it to keep up its offensive until the opponent gives up.

3196.text: It boosts its concentration by emitting harsh cries. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

3197.text: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

3198.text: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

3199.text: Combusken toughens up its legs and thighs by running through fields and mountains. This Pokémon’s legs possess both speed and power, enabling it to dole out 10 kicks in one second.

3200.text: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.

3201.text: BLAZIKEN has incredibly strong legs - it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This POKéMON’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

3202.text: It learns martial arts that use punches and kicks. Every several years, its old feathers burn off, and new, supple feathers grow back in their place.

3203.text: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.

3204.text: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.

3205.text: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.

3206.text: In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokémon’s wrists burn.

3207.text: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

3208.text: On land, it can powerfully lift large boulders by planting its four feet and heaving. It sleeps by burying itself in soil at the water’s edge.

3209.text: Its power can crush boulders. It rests by covering itself with mud at the bottom of a river.

3210.text: Its large tail fin propels it through water with powerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of its size.

3211.text: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

3212.text: The fin on Mudkip’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.

3213.text: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

3214.text: Its toughened hind legs enable it to stand upright. Because it weakens if its skin dries out, it replenishes fluids by playing in mud.

3215.text: It is at its best when on muddy ground with poor footing. It quickly overwhelms foes struggling in mud.

3216.text: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.

3217.text: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

3218.text: The surface of Marshtomp’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This Pokémon plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.

3219.text: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

3220.text: SWAMPERT is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This POKéMON also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

3221.text: SWAMPERT predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

3222.text: If it senses the approach of a storm and a tidal wave, it protects its seaside nest by piling up boulders. It swims as fast as a jet ski.

3223.text: Its arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down its foe. It makes its nest on beautiful beaches.

3224.text: Its arms are hard as rock. With one swing, it can break a boulder into pieces.

3225.text: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

3226.text: Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

3227.text: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

3228.text: At first sight, POOCHYENA takes a bite at anything that moves. This POKéMON chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

3229.text: POOCHYENA is an omnivore - it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This POKéMON tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

3230.text: It savagely threatens foes with bared fangs. It chases after fleeing targets tenaciously. It turns tail and runs, however, if the foe strikes back.

3231.text: It chases its prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it turns tail if the prey strikes back.

3232.text: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

3233.text: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.

3234.text: At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

3235.text: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

3236.text: In the wild, MIGHTYENA live in a pack. They never defy their leader’s orders. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

3237.text: It chases down prey in a pack. It will never disobey the commands of a skilled Trainer.

3238.text: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

3239.text: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

3240.text: Mightyena gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack. It starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body. This Pokémon will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.

3241.text: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

3242.text: Rubbing its nose against the ground, it always wanders about back and forth in search of something. It is distinguished by the zigzag footprints it leaves.

3243.text: It gets interested in everything, which is why it zigs and zags. It is good at finding items.

3244.text: It walks in zigzag fashion. It’s good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.

3245.text: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.

3246.text: Zigzagoon restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This Pokémon does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.

3247.text: The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémon may play dead to fool foes in battle.

3248.text: It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on trees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and calmer than the kind native to Galar.

3249.text: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.

3250.text: It is exceedingly fast if it only has to run in a straight line. When it spots pond- dwelling prey underwater, it quickly leaps in and catches it with its sharp claws.

3251.text: When running in a straight line, it can easily top 60 miles an hour. It has a tough time with curved roads.

3252.text: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

3253.text: Linoone always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This Pokémon is very challenged by gently curving roads.

3254.text: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.

3255.text: Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes made with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.

3256.text: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.

3257.text: Using the spikes on its rear end,   WURMPLE peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This POKéMON’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.

3258.text: WURMPLE is targeted by SWELLOW as prey. This POKéMON will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

3259.text: It sticks to tree branches and eats leaves. The thread it spits from its mouth, which becomes gooey when it touches air, slows the movement of its foes.

3260.text: It lives amidst tall grass and in forests. When attacked, it resists by pointing its venomous spikes at the foe.

3261.text: It spits a white silk that turns sticky when it contacts air. It is used to immobilize foes.

3262.text: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.

3263.text: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a Starly, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.

3264.text: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

3265.text: Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.

3266.text: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

3267.text: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.

3268.text: It prepares for evolution using the energy it stored while it was a WURMPLE. It keeps watch over the surroundings with its two eyes.

3269.text: It conserves its energy by moving as little as possible. It awaits evolution while drinking only a little rainwater.

3270.text: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.

3271.text: Having wrapped silk around the branches of a tree, it quiescently awaits evolution.

3272.text: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
